newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: Czech Cbank asks banks to arrange $1.5 bln credit.
newsitem.headline: Czech Cbank asks banks to arrange $1.5 bln credit.

text.p: The Czech National Bank (CNB) said on Saturday it had mandated four foreign banks to arrange a $1.5 billion, one-year revolving credit facility as a standby to strengthen the CNB's foreign exchange reserves.

A bank spokesman told Reuters the CNB had on Friday mandated Chase Investment Bank Ltd, Commerzbank AG, JP Morgan Securities Ltd and SBC Warburg, a division of Swiss Bank Corp, to arrange the facility. He said the facility would be placed with a limited group of core relationship banks.
"It is being arranged to strengthen the foreign reserves of the Czech National Bank as a standby facility," he said.
